conditions: Store below 25°C in a cool, dry place

permittedIndications.evidenceNotes: Supported by multiple clinical trials on Lactobacillus and Bifidobacterium strains
Clinical evidence shows probiotic supplementation increases beneficial bacteria counts
Gut microbiome plays crucial role in immune function - supported by systematic reviews
Traditional use and emerging research on gut-brain axis

indicationRequirements: If symptoms persist, talk to your health professional
Always read the label and follow the directions for use
Not recommended during antibiotic treatment unless advised by healthcare professional
standardIndications: No Standard Indications included on Record
specificIndications: No Specific Indications included on Record
warnings: Always read the label and follow the directions for use
If symptoms persist, talk to your health professional
Not recommended for severely immunocompromised individuals
Discontinue use if adverse reactions occur
Store in refrigerator after opening to maintain potency

structuredWarnings.text: Always read the label and follow the directions for use
If symptoms persist, talk to your health professional
Not recommended for severely immunocompromised individuals
Discontinue use if adverse reactions occur
Store in refrigerator after opening to maintain potency

dosageInformation.adults: Take 1-2 capsules daily with food, or as directed by your healthcare professional. Best taken with breakfast or dinner.
dosageInformation.children: Children 12+ years: Take 1 capsule daily with food. Not recommended for children under 12 years.
dosageInformation.generalNotes: Take with food to enhance survival of probiotic strains. Maintain consistent timing for optimal results. Can be taken continuously or as recommended by healthcare professional.

allergenInformation.allergenStatement: Contains milk and soy products. Free from gluten, eggs, nuts, and shellfish. Manufactured in a facility that also processes wheat.

supplierDetails.purityTest: ≥10 billion CFU/g, Identity confirmed by 16S rRNA sequencing

supplierDetails.supplierAddress: 321 Research Park Drive, Perth WA 6000, Australia
supplierDetails.purityTest: ≥2 billion CFU/g, Antibiotic resistance profile verified

clinicalEvidence.study: Multi-strain Probiotic Efficacy in Digestive Health
clinicalEvidence.summary: Double-blind RCT (n=120) showing 28-day supplementation improved digestive comfort scores by 65% vs placebo

clinicalEvidence.study: Immune Function Enhancement with Probiotic Supplementation
clinicalEvidence.summary: 12-week study (n=200) demonstrated 23% reduction in upper respiratory infections
clinicalEvidence.primaryEndpoint: Incidence of upper respiratory tract infections

clinicalEvidence.summary: 16S rRNA sequencing showed 340% increase in beneficial bacteria diversity after 4 weeks

regulatoryCompliance.regulatoryNotes: Product meets all TGA requirements for listed medicines. Annual compliance review completed.

additionalProductInformation.productDescription: ProBiotic Complete Advanced Formula is a premium multi-strain probiotic supplement containing 28 billion CFU of five clinically studied probiotic strains. Each enteric-coated capsule is designed to survive stomach acid and deliver live beneficial bacteria directly to the intestines. Enhanced with prebiotic inulin fiber to support probiotic growth and colonization. Manufactured in a TGA-certified GMP facility using pharmaceutical-grade ingredients sourced from certified Australian suppliers.
additionalProductInformation.targetMarket: Adults and adolescents seeking to maintain digestive health, support immune function, and promote beneficial gut flora balance
competitiveAdvantages: Multi-strain formula with clinically proven strains
High potency 28 billion CFU per capsule
Enteric coating for enhanced survival and delivery
Added prebiotic fiber for synbiotic effect
Manufactured in Australia to pharmaceutical standards

components.visualIdentification: Clear capsule with white to off-white powder, enteric coated for delayed release

clinicalTrials.title: Multi-strain Probiotic Supplementation and Digestive Health: A Randomized Controlled Trial
clinicalTrials.outcomeSummary: 28-day supplementation with multi-strain probiotic significantly improved digestive comfort scores (p<0.001) and increased beneficial bacteria counts by 340% compared to placebo
clinicalTrials.population: Healthy adults aged 25-65 with mild digestive discomfort (n=120)
clinicalTrials.intervention: Multi-strain probiotic containing L. acidophilus, B. lactis, L. plantarum, B. longum, and L. rhamnosus (28 billion CFU total)

clinicalTrials.title: Probiotic Supplementation and Immune Function in Healthy Adults
clinicalTrials.outcomeSummary: 12-week probiotic supplementation reduced incidence of upper respiratory tract infections by 23% and improved immune markers

evidenceRegulatorySummary.overallEvidenceStatement: Strong clinical evidence supports the use of multi-strain probiotics for digestive health maintenance. The specific strains included have been extensively studied in randomized controlled trials with consistent positive outcomes for gut health and immune function support.
keyRegulatoryPoints: All probiotic strains are Generally Recognized as Safe (GRAS) by FDA
Manufacturing facility holds TGA GMP certification
Product meets Australian probiotic supplement standards
Strain identification confirmed by 16S rRNA sequencing

references.citation: Hill, C., et al. (2023). Multi-strain probiotics for digestive health: A systematic review and meta-analysis. Journal of Functional Foods, 45(2), 234-248.
Smith, J.A., et al. (2023). Effects of multi-strain probiotic supplementation on gut microbiome diversity: A randomized controlled trial. Gut Microbes, 14(1), 2089-2103.
Johnson, M.K., et al. (2023). Probiotic supplementation and immune function: A meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials. Nutrients, 15(8), 1892.

interactions.effect: Antibiotics may reduce the effectiveness of probiotic supplements by killing beneficial bacteria
interactions.mechanism: Broad-spectrum antibiotics can eliminate both pathogenic and beneficial bacteria, reducing probiotic efficacy
interactions.managementAdvice: Take probiotics 2-3 hours after antibiotic dose. Continue probiotic supplementation for 2-4 weeks after completing antibiotic course

evidenceReferences.summary: Clinical study showing reduced probiotic survival during concurrent antibiotic therapy

interactions.effect: Potential risk of systemic infection in severely immunocompromised patients
interactions.mechanism: Live bacteria may pose infection risk in patients with severely compromised immune systems
interactions.managementAdvice: Consult healthcare professional before use if taking immunosuppressive medications

evidenceReferences.summary: Case reports of probiotic-related infections in immunocompromised patients

contraindications.description: Patients with severe immunodeficiency, organ transplant recipients, or those receiving high-dose immunosuppressive therapy
Patients with central venous catheters may have increased risk of bacteremia
Probiotics may worsen acute pancreatitis in some cases

adverseEffects.effectDescription: Mild gastrointestinal discomfort, bloating, or gas
adverseEffects.management: Usually resolves within 3-5 days as gut adjusts. Reduce dose temporarily if needed.
Normal adaptation response. Maintain adequate hydration.
Discontinue immediately and seek medical attention if severe reaction occurs.

intendedPopulation.specificConsiderations: Suitable for vegetarians. Not suitable for vegans due to milk-derived ingredients. Individuals with compromised immune systems should consult healthcare professional before use.

storageShelfLife.storageConditions: Store below 25°C in a cool, dry place. Refrigerate after opening to maintain potency. Protect from light and moisture.
storageShelfLife.useByInstructions: Use within 6 months of opening. Keep refrigerated after opening.

documentInformation.dataEntrySource: Product Label, TGA Summary, Clinical Trial Data, and Manufacturer Specifications
documentInformation.notes: Comprehensive OSI data entry including enhanced clinical evidence, interaction data, and regulatory compliance information. Data verified against TGA ARTG database and clinical trial registries.
